metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5286 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Image Service (Glance) before 2014.2.4 (juno) and 2015.1.x before 2015.1.2 (kilo) allows remote authenticated users to bypass the storage quota and cause a denial of service (disk consumption) by deleting images that are being uploaded using a token that expires during the process. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-9623.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glance - 2:11.0.0-0ubuntu1
glance-api - 2:11.0.0-0ubuntu1
glance-common - 2:11.0.0-0ubuntu1
glance-registry - 2:11.0.0-0ubuntu1
python-glance - 2:11.0.0-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glance package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:11.0.0-0ubuntu1').
